channel.title: [RGSS] Luminance - Criticism Needed [BETA RELEASE V1.3]
channel.description:
This was started after seeing someone create a MUD game it was really cool and wanted to do something similiar, feedback will be essential, also any suggestions as I am early in the Developement will be very much appreciated.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ucAWmZS-3Tw http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VeiFXx-AhRY
v1.2 http://www.mediafire.com/?ms4hokg01ggh1pg v1.3 http://dl.dropbox.com/u/35348593/Luminance/Luminance.exe
Update Log: [code]19th January: Started development and have added the first map alongside a party. 20th January: Added the second section after the starting point and added the city 21st January: Added Dungeons and extension on the City. 22nd January: Added minimap and HuD. Got RiiPiiN to make me the title screen. Completely finished the extension on the city.(will release it in v1.4) 23rd January: Began to add a story line. Working on a website and uploading a new video. To show a little of the story line.[/code]
I will release the next beta phase right after I have completely finished the town extension.

Only just got back to my computer, been away for a few days. Watched the video before I gotta leave for work lol. Also, no, its not a bad thing, its just something that came to mind.[/quote]
Ok, try to have fun at work and something a bit off topic.

This is our website’s homepage not online yet but pretty soon, I have stopped game development till the website is ready

welp here you go:

Websitess.png774×674

item.title: [RGSS] Luminance - Criticism Needed [BETA RELEASE V1.3]
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

[quote=“lemme_winks_, post:46, topic:429945”][quote author=dain bramage link=topic=532629.msg3896148#msg3896148 date=1327310738]

Lawl, you’re trying to claim you made this, you’re using another Engine to create this, a RPG Maker, same textboxes, same shit.
LOL, don’t come here and try and fool these children.

he still made it. you might as well say this to every other game company that doesn’t write their own software to make their own games, ie: using blender, unity3D, unreal, or .

using pre-made frameworks and engines are smarter anyways if you don’t like being a badass. what’s so hard about dragging and dropping objects, modifying their attributes and throwing in a little script to give them some functionality? girl, please. if this guy throws some time and hard work into this, i’m sure it’d be awesome, and I would buy it (maybe if it were under a dollar).

All those other engines require skill to use.
A 10 year old could use RPGMaker.
[/quote]

the op is 10[/quote]

Not true, I’m 10 and a half.

Read full topic
